name: Students for Fair Admissions v. President and Fellows of Harvard College
question:
May institutions of higher education use race as a factor in admissions?

If so, does Harvard College’s race-conscious admissions process violate Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964?
description: A case in which the Court overruled its decision in Grutter v. Bollinger to hold that institutions of higher education cannot use race as a factor in admissions.
